page.title: 20SHOPPING SURVEY IN WHITTON
page.content: At about 11.30 am on July 2nd 1985 we visited a small parade of shops at the corner of Hospital Bridge Road and Staines Road: a tobacconist/grocer, a grocer, a butcher, an off licence/post office/video shop and a newsagent. They are 'everyday' shops with regular and local customers. At the butchers the elder of the two men behind the counter told us that the busiest day is Friday. He said he loved his job. For the third year running he has become a champion sausage-maker. He had to go to Yorkshire to have his sausages judged. We heard that what actually went into his sausages was a secret. The two Asian women at the counter in the grocers said their busiest day was a Saturday. Pension day was very busy at the newsagents we were told. WHITTON SCHOOL
